channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Interplay Between Cap Rates and Interest Rates
item.description: What is the relationship between cap rates and interest rates? It's not as straightforward as you may think.

item.title: The FDA lost a whistleblower complaint about unsanitary conditions at an infant formula plant for a year, auditors revealed
item.description: It wasn’t found until a reporter requested it in June 2022.

item.title: Still Misperceived? A Fresh Look at Bitcoin Volatility
item.description: Is Bitcoin considerably more volatile than other asset classes? It's important to approach this question analytically and with an open mind because perceptions do not always match reality.

item.title: Donald Trump aims to entice CEOs with lucrative tax cuts while Biden wants to win them over by vowing to maintain stability
item.description: The influential Business Roundtable plans to spend $10 million on a campaign for business-friendly tax codes.

item.title: FX Bubbles: Through the Lens of Shiller and Sornette
item.description: The theories and models introduced by Robert Shiller and Didier Sornette are as applicable to the foreign exchange market as they are to the stock market.

item.title: A 58-year-old Canadian man stole trade secrets from Tesla and tried to sell them on YouTube, authorities say
item.description: His accomplice is still at large, according to the Department of Justice.

item.title: Book Review: A Wealth of Well-Being
item.description: Finance practitioners can benefit from Meir Statman's challenge to make finance an “afterthought” and spend more time thinking about life well-being.

item.title: Elon Musk’s $46 billion told-ya-so: love for ‘incredible’ shareholders, dunks on New York investors, and the promise of a 110x increase in value
item.description: A buoyant Musk thanked Tesla’s shareholders after they voted to reinstate his pay package, the largest in corporate history. “Hot damn, I love you guys.”

item.title: What’s Your Client’s Optimal Equity Allocation?
item.description: Note to investment advisors: You may be overestimating the risks of equities for conservative investors with longer investment horizons.

item.title: CEOs make nearly 200 times more than other workers and their pay hikes keep outpacing employees. It’s an ‘outrage,’ a top advisor says
item.description: More than 95% of Democrats, and two thirds of Republicans, say reducing CEO pay is an important issue.
